title: How to Make Your Own Peanut Butter Larabar

steps.headline: Put the peanuts in the blender first and chop them down pretty fine.
Add the pitted dates with the salt.
Blend together for a couple of minutes.
steps.description: Check their consistency and push in the mixture and continue blending.

steps.headline: Repeat the process until it has reached a suitably thick mixture.
steps.description: That is why it helps if you process the dates separately.

steps.headline: Add any optional ingredients.
steps.description: Once you have the mixture at about the best consistency, then add your final products. Make sure they are already cut before adding them.

steps.headline: Blend the peanuts and set them aside.
steps.description: You can blend in the chia seeds now, if you would like.

steps.headline: Blend the pitted dates.
steps.description: Do this until it is almost paste like.

steps.headline: Blend in the peanuts that you set aside, until they are of the proper consistency.
Cut a piece of wax (or parchment) paper and lay on your cookie sheet.
Spread out the peanut mixture.
steps.description: Spread a piece of wax paper or plastic wrap on the mixture and roll it until it is about a half inch thick.

steps.headline: Cut your larabars to your desired length.
steps.description: A good size is 1 X 2 or 2.5 inches (6.3 cm).

steps.headline: Using the plastic wrap, wrap your individual bars.
steps.description: After you have them encased in a small piece of plastic, press them together. This flattens them out and helps to firm them up.

text: Steps Put the peanuts in the blender first and chop them down pretty fine.  Add the pitted dates with the salt.  Blend together for a couple of minutes. Check their consistency and push in the mixture and continue blending. Repeat the process until it has reached a suitably thick mixture. That is why it helps if you process the dates separately. Add any optional ingredients. Once you have the mixture at about the best consistency, then add your final products. Make sure they are already cut before adding them. Alternative Preparation Method Blend the peanuts and set them aside. You can blend in the chia seeds now, if you would like. Blend the pitted dates. Do this until it is almost paste like. Blend in the peanuts that you set aside, until they are of the proper consistency.  Wrapping Your Larabars Cut a piece of wax (or parchment) paper and lay on your cookie sheet.  Spread out the peanut mixture. Spread a piece of wax paper or plastic wrap on the mixture and roll it until it is about a half inch thick. Cut your larabars to your desired length. A good size is 1 X 2 or 2.5 inches (6.3 cm). Using the plastic wrap, wrap your individual bars. After you have them encased in a small piece of plastic, press them together. This flattens them out and helps to firm them up.
